properties.title: Azure Virtual Desktop LZA: Deploy New Session Hosts

elements.name: ComputeResourceGroup
elements.label: Pool compute resource group
elements.toolTip: Select the name of the existing resource group where the host pool compute resources will be deployed.

options.text: Azure Virtual Desktop Landing Zones will create the resource group hierarchy under the subscriptions with the prefix provided in this step.

elements.name: deploymentPrefix
elements.label: Prefix
elements.toolTip: Provide a prefix (max 4 characters) for the resource groups and resources created as part of Azure Virtual Desktop landing zones.

elements.name: deploymentEnvironment
elements.label: Environment
elements.toolTip: Select the type of environment (Development (d), Test (t), Production (p)) that will be deployed, this information will be use as part of the resources naming.

options.text: Azure Virtual Desktop LZA deployment expects identity service to be already available in the current Azure estate.

elements.name: identityServiceProvider
elements.label: Identity service provider
elements.toolTip: Identity service provider (ADDS or AADDS) that already exist and will be used for Azure Virtual Desktop.

elements.name: identityServiceProviderIntuneEnrollment
elements.label: Intune enrollment
elements.toolTip: If Intune is configured in your Microsoft Entra ID tenant, you can choose to have the VM automatically enrolled during the deployment by selecting this box.

options.text: Identity service provider must already exist, as they are a prerequisite for the Azure Virtual Desktop LZA deployment.

elements.name: secretsKeyvault
elements.label: Key vault
elements.toolTip: Select the AVD LZA deployed keyvault that contains the local user and domain join credentials.

elements.name: identityDomainJoinUserName
elements.label: Domain join principal name
elements.toolTip: Provide username with permissions to join session host to the domain.

elements.name: identityDomainJoinUserPassword
elements.label: Domain Join Password secret name
elements.toolTip: Provide keyvault secret name for domain join password.

elements.name: identityLocalUserName
elements.label: VM local admin username
elements.toolTip: Provide username for session host local admin account. Administrator can't be used as username, it is reserved by the system.

constraints.validationMessage: This username can't be used, it is a reserved word.

elements.name: identityLocalUserPassword
elements.label: VM local admin password secret name
elements.toolTip: Provide keyvault secret name for VM local admin password.

elements.name: fslogixStorageAccountSelector
elements.label: Host pool
elements.toolTip: Select host pool where to add new session hosts.

elements.name: sessionHostsRegionSection
elements.label: Region Settings
elements.tooltip: The section allows you to specify the region where the compute, storage, and key vault resources are deployed.

options.text:
If you select 'Use availability zones' below, some regions may not be available for deployment of session hosts because not all regions support Availability Zones. 

The 'Session hosts region' drop down will automatically update based on this selection. If the value changes to blank, select an alternate region or set 'Use availability zones' to 'No'.

elements.name: sessionHostsAvailabilityZoneSettings
elements.label: Availability zones
elements.toolTip: Distribute compute resources across availability zones.

elements.name: sessionHostsAvailabilitySetSettings
elements.label: Availability set
elements.toolTip: Use availability sets to distribute session hosts across fault and update domains.

elements.name: sessionHostsRegion
elements.label: Session hosts region
elements.toolTip: Select the region where the session hosts and required resources are to be deployed.

constraints.allowedValues: [if(equals(steps('sessionHosts').sessionHostsRegionSection.sessionHostsAvailabilitySettings, false), map(first(map(filter(steps('sessionHosts').sessionHostsRegionSection.computeApi.value, (resourceTypes) => equals(resourceTypes.resourceType, 'virtualMachines')), (item) => item.locations)), (item) => parse(concat('{"label":"', item, '","value":"', toLower(replace(item, ' ', '')), '"}'))), map(filter(first(map(filter(steps('sessionHosts').sessionHostsRegionSection.computeApi.value, (resourceTypes) => equals(resourceTypes.resourceType, 'virtualMachines')), (item) => item.zoneMappings)), (item) => equals(length(item.zones), 3)), (item) => parse(concat('{"label":"', item.location, '","value":"', toLower(replace(item.location, ' ', '')), '"}'))))]

elements.name: sessionHostsComputeStorageSection
elements.label: General settings
elements.tooltip: This settings apply to compute, storage, image management and key vault resources.

elements.name: identityDomainOuPath
elements.label: Custom OU path (Optional)
elements.toolTip: Provide OU where to locate session hosts, if not provided session hosts will be placed on the default (computers) OU.

options.text: Session host virtual machine sizing guidelines.

elements.name: sessionHostsCountIndex
elements.label: VM count index
elements.toolTip: Provide the number of the highest sessio host name count, example: if highest session host count is vmavd1duse20005, provide a count index of 5. This number will be use to deploy new session hosts with a naming that continues the current session hosts deployed, example: vmavd1duse20006.

elements.name: sessionHostsCount
elements.label: VM count
elements.toolTip: Provide the number of session hosts to deploy (1-100).

constraints.validationMessage: The count must be between 1-100 session hosts.

elements.name: sessionHostDiskType
elements.label: OS Disk type
elements.toolTip: Select session host disk type to host the OS.

elements.name: sessionHostDiskZeroTrust
elements.label: Zero trust disk configuration
elements.toolTip: Enables disk encryption and Zero trust settings on management VM and session hosts disks

options.text: Zero trust disk encryption requires feature EncryptionAtHost of resource provider Microsoft.Compute to be registered in the subscription.

elements.name: acceleratedNetworking
elements.label: Enable accelerated networking
elements.toolTip: Enables low latency and high throughput on the network interface.

options.text: The Compute Gallery Image definition selected must have the 'isAcceleratedNetworkSupported' feature property set to 'true' if you enable accelerated networking on the session hosts.

elements.name: sessionHostsImageSource
elements.label: OS image source
elements.toolTip: Select marketplace or build custom image to deploy the session hosts.

elements.name: sessionHostsOsImage
elements.label: OS version
elements.toolTip: Select the operating system version of the session hosts.

options.text: Setting the Security Type to anything other than 'Standard' requires that the Azure Compute Gallery Image Definition be configured with the Security Type feature set to the appropriate value. You can determine if the image definition supports the required feature by reviewing the 'Properties' tab on the 'Overview' node of the Gallery Image Definition in the portal. If the image definition does not contain these feature options, then the deployment will fail.

elements.name: securityType
elements.label: Security type
elements.toolTip: Choose a type of security that matches your needs: Standard includes basic protections at no additional cost. Trusted launch virtual machines provide additional security features on Gen2 virtual machines to protect against persistent and advanced attacks.

elements.name: secureBootEnabled
elements.label: Enable secure boot
elements.toolTip: Secure boot helps protect your VMs against boot kits, rootkits, and kernel-level malware.

elements.name: vTpmEnabled
elements.label: Enable vTPM
elements.toolTip: Virtual Trusted Platform Module (vTPM) is TPM2.0 compliant and validates your VM boot integrity apart from securely storing keys and secrets.

elements.name: fslogixConfiguration
elements.label: Configure FSLogix
elements.toolTip: Configure session host to use FSLogix.

elements.name: identityDomainName
elements.label: AD Domain name
elements.toolTip: The full qualified domain name of the on-premises domain where the hybrid identities originated from, this information is used for Azure files authentication setup.

elements.name: fslogixStorageAccountSelector
elements.label: Storage account
elements.toolTip: Select storage account created and configured to host FSLogix user profile containers.

elements.name: fslogixStorageAccountFileShare
elements.label: File share name
elements.toolTip: The name of the file share created and configured to host FSLogix user profile containers.

options.text: FSLogix configuration requires the storage account and file share to be already configured for authentication with ADDS or Microsoft Entra Domain Services.
FSLogix configuration requires the storage account and file share to be already configured for authentication with Microsoft Entra ID.
FSLogix storage for Microsoft Entra ID joined session hosts is currently only available for hybrid identities.

elements.name: virtualNetworkSubnetSelectorName
elements.label: Subnet
elements.toolTip: Azure Virtual Desktop subnet.

elements.name: applicationSecurityGroup
elements.label: Application Security Group (ASG)
elements.toolTip: Configure session host to use FSLogix.

elements.name: configureMonitoring
elements.label: Configure monitoring
elements.toolTip: Deploy monitoring settings and if selected deploy Azure log analytics workspace.

options.text: Azure Virtual Desktop monitoring requires an existing Azure Log Analytics Workspace or the creation of a new one.
Deployment will configured all required settings to use the Azure Virtual Desktop insights workbook.
Azure Virtual Desktop LZA default naming scheme is shown in this diagram.

elements.name: resourceNamingSelection
elements.label: Custom resource naming
elements.toolTip: When selected, the information provided will be used to name resources. When set to 'No' deployment will use the Azure Virtual Desktop LZA naming standard.

options.text: When using custom naming for resources, please make sure to follow naming rules and restrictions for Azure resources.

elements.name: sessionHostCustomNamePrefix
elements.label: Session host prefix
elements.toolTip: Azure Virtual Desktop session host prefix custom name.

options.text: It is recommended to follow Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework (CAF) naming convention.

elements.name: resourceTaggingSelection
elements.label: Create resource tags
elements.toolTip: When selected, the information provided will be used to create tags on resources and resource groups.

options.text:
By default, the following tags will be created:
- Parent resource cost management tag (cm-resource-parent): reports all resources cost to the host pool (ResourceID).
- Environment (Environment): environment selected during deployment (Dev/Test/prod).
- Service Workload (ServiceWorkload): defaults to Azure Virtual Desktop.
- Creation time (CreationTimeUTC): deployment time in UTC.
- Domain Name (DomainName): identity service domain name (applied only to compute and storage).
- Identity service provider (IdentityServiceProvider): identity provider selected (ADDS/AADDS/AAD).

elements.name: tagsWorkloadName
elements.label: Workload name:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named WorkloadName.

elements.name: tagsWorkloadType
elements.label: Workload type:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named WorkloadType, reference to the size of the VM for your workloads.

elements.name: tagsDataClassificationTag
elements.label: Data classification:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named DataClassification, reference to the sensitivity of data hosted.

elements.name: tagsDepartmentTag
elements.label: Department:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named Department, reference the department that owns the deployment.

elements.name: tagsCriticalityTag
elements.label: Workload criticality:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named Criticality, reference to the criticality of the workload.

elements.name: tagsCustomWorkloadCriticality
elements.label: Custom workload criticality:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named Criticality, reference to a custom criticality for the workload.

elements.name: tagsApplicationNameTag
elements.label: Application name:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named ApplicationName, reference details about the application.

elements.name: tagsWorkloadSlaTag
elements.label: Workload SLA:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named ServiceClass, reference to the service level agreement level of the worload.

elements.name: tagsOpsTeamTag
elements.label: Operations team:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named OpsTeam, reference to the team accountable for day-to-day operations.

elements.name: tagsOwnerTag
elements.label: Owner:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named Owner, reference to the organizational owner of the Azure Virtual Desktop deployment.

elements.name: tagsCostCenterTag
elements.label: Cost center:
elements.toolTip: This input will be the value of a tag named CostCenter, reference to the cost center of owner team.
